column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=And I think also what we need to do is is that we need to ask the oil companies why it is that they 're always a little bit short .
#Text=It could be that they do n't refine things like they should .
#Text=They always make it to where the demand is a little bit more than supply just to keep that extra pressure on oil .
#Text=That needs to be investigated too .
#Text=That needs to be more tightly regulated because energy is like money .
#Text=The banks are the same way , energy 's no different .
#Text=One 's the veins of the economy and one 's the arteries of the economy .
#Text=And both those things need more federal oversight .
#Text=They make plenty of profit , no one 's talking about taking them over .
#Text=But they need to be regulated .
#Text=And these artificial shortages and things should n't be allowed to happen .
#Text=You ca n't do that .
#Text=What they got is basically a monopoly .
#Text=All this would be doing is just like regulating phone companies .
#Text=There can only be a few people who do it .
#Text=There 's not going to be that much competition .
#Text=We know that .

#Text=So they actually , when a sector of the economy basically is in oligopolistic or monopolistic hands , that the government 's got a right to step in and regulate on behalf of the people , because the more money that goes into energy unnecessarily , just like interest at the bank and things like that , then that hurts other parts of the economy .
#Text=That means people have less money to spend at Wal-Mart .
#Text=They have less money to buy furniture .
#Text=They have less money to buy other goods .
#Text=Same with healthcare , that 's why you have to regulate that .
#Text=It 's somewhat of a monopoly as well considering that the health care industry , the insurance companies do n't have to compete .
#Text=By law , they 've been exempt from competition for about 50 or 60 years , which really has n't worked out too well .
#Text=I mean what we have to pay equals six or eight percent of GDP , which is twice what they have to pay in Germany in relation to their GDP .
#Text=You know Germany out-exports the United States , a country of 70 million , because they do n't have to factor all these health care costs for their products .
#Text=Health care should be something that is individual and not related to the work .
#Text=It should be paid for through the taxes .

#Text=People should be afforded so much health care costs , so many health care costs , like take for instance in Germany , exports go up , prices on exports get more competitive , trade deficit narrows and people have more work because you have more exports .
#Text=The United States is hurt .
#Text=We 're the only one of our competitors that does n't have some form of a single payer that controls costs and gives people a choice of doctors .
#Text=As a result , that has to be built in to the cost of the product and that makes us less competitive , makes the trade balance larger .

#Text=Germany , again , a nation of 70 million , actual gross dollars , not per capita , gross dollars or Euros , out-exports the United States of America , which has four and a half times the people of Germany , and that 's pathetic .
